WorkPlace.Name: Semco Maritime
WorkPlace.OrganizationDescription: Dedicated to the energy sector, Semco Maritime is an international contracting and engineering company. For more than 30 years we have been facilitating design, fabrication, service and maintenance of our customers’ assets, providing comprehensive project management across all phases of energy projects. Semco Maritime is an international company with branches in Denmark, Norway, UK, UAE, Singapore, Vietnam, Central America and USA.

HiringOrg.Name: Semco Maritime
HiringOrg.OrganizationDescription: Dedicated to the energy sector, Semco Maritime is an international contracting and engineering company. For more than 30 years we have been facilitating design, fabrication, service and maintenance of our customers’ assets, providing comprehensive project management across all phases of energy projects. Semco Maritime is an international company with branches in Denmark, Norway, UK, UAE, Singapore, Vietnam, Central America and USA.

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Do you want to be a part of creating and managing some of the largest Offshore Substation Projects? Are you passionate about leading high-performance teams ensuring that you are delivering the best results? Then you have found the perfect match!

Your position 
As our new Construction Manager, you will be joining our Renewables Division where we handle several large-scale multidiscipline EPCI projects, which are to be constructed in Denmark, Asia, and Poland.
 
Your tasks & responsibilities 
Your largest responsibility as a Construction Manager at Semco Maritime will be to ensure that the projects are built safely and within the agreed timeframe and budget. Furthermore, you will be the HSE example everybody needs to look up to and is responsible for upholding safety standards together with the HSE supervisor.
 
Your tasks will include but are not limited to:
  • Organizing and performing construction work, all site activities, including resource planning
  • Creating job packages for site installation activities
  • Client interface and project meetings
  • Developing weekly status and progress reports
  • Ensuring compliance with the project schedule and quality of work
Your profile & qualifications 
The most important factor is that you have a technical background and interest. There are many possible entryways to this position, for instance, you have previously worked as a Construction or Site Manager or maybe you have experience from working as a strong supervisor or site engineer and want to step up your career.

Outside of your professional life it is important that you have a good sense of working with people from many different backgrounds and enjoy creating and contributing to a good working environment.
 
To succeed in this position, we expect that you:
  • Have technical knowledge
  • Possess good IT-skills
  • Have experience in management field
  • Have experience from working on construction sites
  • Preferably have some practical experience from the offshore business
Welcome to Semco Maritime 
We offer you an interesting and challenging job in an international organization, where we strive to provide innovative and sustainable solutions globally. You will get the unique opportunity to work in an environment characterized by dedication, passion and ambition. 

You will mainly be working at one of our construction sites, however between projects you may choose to work from either our location in Esbjerg, Ballerup or Gdynia, depending on what is the most convenient option for you.
 
We conduct our interviews on an ongoing basis, so if you are interested, you must submit your application as soon as possible via the link on the page. 
If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Kasper Thomsen at +45 30 38 64 40.
 
We look forward to hearing from you!
